page.title: 12Farming in the Addingtons.
page.content: SOILS Most soil is heavy boulder clay and limestone Â£brash'. TYPES Mainly in the Addingtons it is arable and crops like wheat,barley, oats,oilseed rape and grass. LIVESTOCK Most livestock is in Great Addington there are beef animals,sheep, pigs and poultry. AREA With in the parishes there are 3000 acres of farmland and 6 farms. S.T.MARY'S FARM LITTLE ADDINGTON. S.T.Mary's farm owns 800 acres out of 3000.540acres of wheat 176 acres of oil seed rape the rest is grass,flood land and wood.There are 3 men to 6 tractors,4 of them are 4 wheel drive. There are 2 ploughs, 7 cultivation implements,3 combine harvesters,some grain handling equipment{2 augers} and 2 grain stores.
